intro: Humiria floribunda var. subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved humiria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
